fields.description: The dominant part of the time spent running the integration tests is one test case named "generated_large_batch.json". It is not obvious how useful this test case is. Ideally, integration test cases should be small enough to only take a fraction of a second.

comments.body: It's used to verify that gRPC is configured to allow large message payloads by default in Flight. I think we could reduce the size though (to a few 10s of MBs instead of the very large size it currently is).
Do we need to use the integration tests for that? It goes through a costly JSON conversion step.
That's true. They could be made into in-process tests.
